abstract: In the convoluted world of corporate tax accounting, corporate money that is technically overseas is often held in American banks.
snippet: In the convoluted world of corporate tax accounting, corporate money that is technically overseas is often held in American banks.
lead_paragraph: Like some of the nation’s prominent chief executives, Apple’s Timothy D. Cook has a simple proposal to help spur the economy and encourage corporate tax compliance: give American companies a tax break to bring to the United States untaxed profits parked overseas.

headline.main: For U.S. Companies, Money ‘Offshore’ Means Manhattan
headline.print_headline: Apple Hits Tax Tension Head-On: For U.S. Companies, Money ‘Offshore’ Means Manhattan

abstract: Jamie Dimon’s victory in a JPMorgan Chase shareholder vote was aided by months of lobbying. | Timothy D. Cook mollified lawmakers who had been furious over Apple’s taxes. | After Warren E. Buffett, will Berkshire Hathaway be able to negotiate such sweet deals? | A lawyer for Rajat K. Gupta argued that wiretap evidence should not have been admitted.
snippet: Jamie Dimon’s victory in a JPMorgan Chase shareholder vote was aided by months of lobbying. | Timothy D. Cook mollified lawmakers who had been furious over Apple’s taxes. | After Warren E. Buffett, will Berkshire Hathaway be able to negotiate such...
lead_paragraph: After months of behind-the-scenes lobbying by JPMorgan Chase officials, Jamie Dimon won shareholder support on Tuesday to keep his chairman role. Only 32.2 percent of the bank’s shares supported a resolution to split the chairman and chief executive jobs, compared with about 40 percent of the shares voted last year. JPMorgan’s stock rose as much as 2.6 percent on Tuesday, before closing up 1.4 percent, at $53.02.

abstract: The Fed chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, supported the central bank’s bond-buying effort, but some officials were already thinking about scaling it back.
snippet: The Fed chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, supported the central bank’s bond-buying effort, but some officials were already thinking about scaling it back.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Despite signs of improvement in the job market, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, Ben S. Bernanke, and most other Fed officials signaled Wednesday that they remained cautious about easing back too quickly on their efforts to stimulate the economy.

headline.main: Fed Endorses Stimulus, but the Message Is Garbled
headline.print_headline: Fed Endorses Stimulus, But Message Is Garbled

abstract: The Leveraged Finance Fights Melanoma benefit at Rockefeller Plaza’s garden on Tuesday night attracted a star-studded Wall Street crowd that raised more than $1.2 million to help fight skin cancer.
snippet: The Leveraged Finance Fights Melanoma benefit at Rockefeller Plaza’s garden on Tuesday night attracted a star-studded Wall Street crowd that raised more than $1.2 million to help fight skin cancer.
lead_paragraph: [View the story “Tuesday’s Wall St. Events” on Storify]

headline.main: Wall Street’s A-List Turns Out to Fight Skin Cancer
